message.entry: Both tables must have the same height for this operation.
Applying the function ''{0}'' to variable ''{1}'' must return an output with the same height.
This operation is not defined between ''{0}'' and ''{1}''. The input that is not a table or timetable must be a numeric or logical array.
The height of the array input must be the same as the height of the table or it must be 1.
The width of the array input must be the same as the width of the table or it must be 1.
N-dimensional arrays are not supported for this operation when one of the inputs is a table.
Both tables must have the same variables.
Both inputs must have the same row labels.
Both inputs must have the same type of row labels.
Both inputs must have the same height. Implicit expansion is not supported when the 1 row input has row labels.
The input tables have incompatible VariableUnits for this operation.
One or more table variables have the VariableUnits defined for one input and not for the other. The operator ''{0}'' assumes the undefined unit to match the other unit.
One or more table variables have the VariableUnits defined for one input and not for the other. The operator ''{0}'' assumes the undefined unit to mean unitless.
Arithmetic operations are not supported when the same custom property name is a per-table property in one table and a per-variable property in the other table.
Linear indices output I is not supported for tabular inputs.
Indices output I is not supported for tabular inputs when applying ''{0}'' over all elements.
All variables must be column vectors when the dimension input is greater than 1.
Variables cannot be tabular when the dimension input is greater than 1.
Row operation requires all variables to have the same unit.
Row times must be sorted (ascending) to use ''{0}'' on a timetable input.
The output of this function must match the size of the input.
Applying the function ''{0}'' to the variable ''{1}'' generated an error.
Applying the function ''{0}'' to the rows of the input table generated an error.
Applying the function ''{0}'' to the input table generated an error.
The function ''{0}'' returned an output with more than one row when applied to variable ''{1}'' in the input table.
Applying the function ''{0}'' to the rows of the input table must return an output with the same height.
Applying the function ''{0}'' to the input table with an empty vector of dimensions or a dimension argument greater than 2 must return an output with the same height.
The function ''{0}'' returned an output with more than one row when applied to the input table.
The function ''{0}'' returned an output with more than one column when applied to the input table.
Dimension input cannot be greater than 2 to use ''diff'' on a tabular input.
Argument at position {0} cannot be of type ''{1}''.
